main event: An observer traveling in a car spotted a high-speed silver disc-shaped object with fins near Huntsville, Ohio on June 11, 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as having a brilliant, polished mirror-like surface., The observer noted that the object had fins resembling those of a seal., The sighting lasted no more than 2.5 minutes., The object flew horizontally and then quickly disappeared., Weather conditions at the time included a few white clouds and bright sunlight.
sighted object: a silver disc-shaped object with fins
witness description: The witness described himself as an employee of Standard Oil, demonstrating average to above average intelligence.
